page.title: 08Shipham's Women's Institute.
page.content: The W.I. was started in Shipham in February 1922, to give local women the chance to catch up a little on their education. In 1950 when Shipham was only a small village there were over 90 members.Today there are 30 members, mostly older women. At the beginning of each monthly meeting business decisions are made like choosing representatives for various regional or national conferences or fixing dates for the next fund raising event. Stimulating talks are the main activity of the evening and the variety of topics can be from miniature dolls furniture to the importance of flower arranging. Sometimes they have competitions for everyone to try like fitting as many things in a matchbox as possible.
